statement:
For every $n \in \mathbb{N}$ ${\left(n\underline{!}\right)_p}$ stands
for the product of numbers between $1$ and $n$ which are not divisible
by a given prime $p$. And we set ${\left(0\underline{!}\right)_p} =1$.

The corollary below generalizes a result first found by Anton,
Stickelberger, and Hensel:

Let $N_0$ be the least non-negative residue of $n \pmod{p^s}$ where $p$
is a prime number and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Then
$${\left(n\underline{!}\right)_p} \equiv \left(\pm 1\right)^{\left\lfloor n/p^s
\right\rfloor}\cdot {\left(N_0\underline{!}\right)_p} \pmod{p^s}.$$

We write each $r$ in the product below as $ip^s +j$ to get
$$\begin{aligned}
{\left(n\underline{!}\right)_p} &=& \prod\limits_{\substack{1 \le r \le n\\ p^s \not\div r}} r \\ &=&\left( 
\prod\limits_{\substack{0 \le i \le \left\lfloor n/p^s\right\rfloor -1 \\ 1 \le j < p^s \\ p^s
\not\div j}} ip^s +j\right)\left( \prod\limits_{\substack{i=\left\lfloor
n/p^s\right\rfloor \\ 1\le j \le N_0 \\ p^s \not\div j}} ip^s +j\right) \\
 &\equiv& \prod\limits_{i=0}^{\left\lfloor n/p^s \right\rfloor -1}
\prod\limits_{\substack{1 \le j < p^s \\ p^s \not\div j }} j\cdot
    \prod\limits_{\substack{j=1 \\ p^s \not\div j}}^{N_0} j) \\
 &\equiv&
{\left(p^s\underline{!}\right)_p}^{\left\lfloor n/p^s\right\rfloor}\cdot {\left(N_0\underline{!}\right)_p} \pmod{p^s}.\end{aligned}$$
From Wilson’s theorem for prime powers it follows that
$${\left(n\underline{!}\right)_p} \equiv
\begin{cases} 
{\left(N_0\underline{!}\right)_p} \text{if} & p=2, s \ge 3 \\
(-1)^{\left\lfloor n/p^s\right\rfloor}\cdot{\left(N_0\underline{!}\right)_p} & \text{otherwise.}
\end{cases} \pmod{p^s}.$$
